alert.note: Alert for Cumberland; Perry (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued January 09 at 7:11PM EST until January 10 at 3:00AM EST by NWS State College
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snow melt continues to be possible. * WHERE...Most of Central Pennsylvania. * WHEN...Through Wednesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Heavy rain is falling on a snowpack. Gusty winds and very mild temperatures are helping to hasten the snow melt. This may cause smaller streams and creeks to quickly overflow their banks. Flows in rivers are also expected to increase, but will take many more hours to do so. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
